etymology.description: 魚(魚) (yú, "fish") as phonetic + 禾(禾) (hé, "grain") as semantic -> sound and meaning combined -> final form 穌
etymology.interpretation: The character 穌(sū, "resuscitate") combines 魚 (yú, "fish") to indicate sound with 禾 (hé, "grain"), which contributes to the overall meaning of revitalization, akin to agricultural growth.
etymology.simplification: The character 穌 was simplified to 稣 by removing the 魚(魚) (yú, "fish") component and retaining only parts that suggest clarity and modern sound.

examples.chinese: 他不慎溺水后(他不慎溺水後)，医生奋力穌他(醫生奮力穌他)。
examples.pinyin: tā bù shèn nì shuǐ hòu, yīshēng fèn lì sū tā.
examples.english: He accidentally nearly drowned, and the doctor resuscitated him with full effort.

examples.chinese: 他在实验室中(他在實驗室中)，穌起了细胞的活力(穌起了細胞的活力)。
examples.pinyin: tā zài shí yàn shì zhōng, sū qǐ le xì bāo de huó lì.
examples.english: While in the laboratory, he revived the vitality of the cells.

examples.chinese: 在抢救行动中(在搶救行動中)，医护人员全力穌病人(醫護人員全力穌病人)。
examples.pinyin: zài qiǎng jiù xíng dòng zhōng, yī hù rén yuán quán lì sū bìng rén.
examples.english: During the rescue operation, the medical staff did their best to resuscitate the patient.
